meanings.definition: The scientific study of magnetic fields.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use magnetometry to learn about magnetic fields.
meanings.sent2: Magnetometry helps researchers understand how magnets work.
meanings.sent3: The magnetometry research team discovered a new way to map magnetic fields.
meanings.sent4: Her fascination with magnetometry was like a compass guiding her through the world of science.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration on magnetometry made the concept easy to grasp.

meanings.definition: The use of magnetic instruments to measure the magnetic properties of materials.
meanings.sent1: The geologist used magnetometry to analyze the rocks' magnetic properties.
meanings.sent2: In archaeology, magnetometry is essential for detecting buried artifacts.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the magnetometry device unexpectedly started beeping.
meanings.sent4: The magnetometry tool acted like a detective uncovering hidden magnetic clues.
meanings.sent5: The precision of magnetometry measurements amazed the researchers.

meanings.sent1: The magnetometry results showed the strength of the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: Researchers rely on magnetometry to quantify magnetic field variations.
meanings.sent3: The magnetometry equipment malfunctioned, causing a funny magnetic field reading.
meanings.sent4: His understanding of magnetometry was like seeing the world through a magnetic lens.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of magnetometry lies in its ability to reveal invisible magnetic forces.
